description:
As good as it gets when you are looking for a dive bar that you might have caught the late Anthony Bourdain in when visiting. That is what led us to the bar in the first place. It was not the speak easy we had intended but I think we landed where we were supposed to. My sister, husband and I wanted to grab a few drinks to top off a visit to the City. 

With the Warriors win on Friday, taking home a 3rd ring and officially becoming a dynasty, to the passing of Kate Spade and Anthony Bourdain all in the same week to suicide there was something in us that just wanted to etch some family time in just to check in. 

This place is in walking distance of my mother's place and it definitely did what we needed it to. This place is right on Larkin before you get to Eddy if you are coming from City Hall. To get there you of course side step random homeless people that are either yelling at you or having a deep conversation with a graffiti ridden wall, possible street walkers and you know how on the Vegas strip the ground is littered with stripper advertisement well here in the Loin it's needles, so watch your step! Once you can shake all that off the Loin is what it is..has been for years and at least their consistent with it..ha!

There's a signage outside the bar that the words "BoozeLand" catches your eye before the actual name of the joint which I think may be a ploy and what they wanted you to see to coerce you for your patronage. 

You walk into a dimly lit place, smell of cigarette in the air, music blaring, the bar to the left and a tall, bearded middle aged man comin in hot at you to the right flashlight in hand ready to look at your ID's. 

The bar wasn't crowded, there was a birthday gathering in one corner and I offered my sister and husband to find seating while they ordered our drinks. I found seating for 3 around the corner on the back end of the bar. Which was funny because as I sat there the bartender's came over to me twice to take drink orders. So both my hubby and sister had beers and I wanted to try an Old Fashioned. That bartender was trying to lay a girl out with that drink...oooooooooowwwwwwiieeeee! I asked him to add some more maraschino cherries to cut some of the edge off and he diligently obliged.

The ambiance is what you would expect of a dive bar. There was a big screen on the wall playing Bettlejuice and the juke box playing an array of genre's to appease the masses regardless of preference, but wasn't so overpoweringly loud that you couldn't have a conversation. Prices are decent for being in SF. We didn't venture off into the back area wherein I was told there was a patio are as well as a pool table. Nor did I have a need to check out their restroom to be able to include in this review but this won't be our last visit I am sure.
author: AmErica A.

description:
Summary: Cheap booze and had a lot of seats for our large group.

Super divey. A lot of locals in the area just getting a drink, playing pool, and chillin'. Booze was not expensive. $7 for a shot of tequila, a lime, and a can of Modelo. When we arrived at 7:30pm, our group just chilled in the back lounge corner area. Bartenders were really nice.

Would come back again if I was in the area.

ProTip: They take card now.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
I was led here by the Bachelor party in the late afternoon.  I'm not sure if Boozeland is in a good or bad neighborhood of San Francisco, but Boozeland itself seems to be a classy sanctuary of an island safely away from the homeless.  Inside its clean casual yet upscale at the same time.  There's a pool table, in the back, and even an outside patio for you cancer loving smokers.  

I love my whiskeys, and I know Red Breast 12 year Irish Whiskey runs about $60 a bottle. So I was shocked and happy that it was only $9 for a very heavy pour of this tasty whiskey.  The barman was extremely friendly   and generous.  

Not sure when I'll ever come back here, but if this was in walking distance of my SF flat, I'd probably be a regular.
author: Chun P.

description: Not my favorite bar but for a dive bar it is pretty nice. There is an outdoor area where people can smoke. My favorite bar is that the bathroom are really nice for a bar. Good selection of beer and cider. They do have wine and cocktails but not sure how those were.
author: Tina L.

description: So I'm gonna give this bar five fuckin stars!! Everyone in here is cool as fuck nice and makes good drinks! MICHELLE is my number Bartender, no one in the world pours like her. Then the last time I was there I met this cunt named Liam! This dude is the shit, the best person I have met in a long time. Hella down to earth and hella cool! Because of these to Michelle and Mr. Cunt Liam I will forever visit this bar!! BOOZELAND LAND FOREVA!! ‍
author: Baron W.

description:
Great dive bar with pool table, strong drinks, and reasonable prices. Cash only but there's an ATM and bartenders are super sweet and friendly.

Very welcoming space and not at all pretentious. Will definitely be back!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Had a f'g good time at this place. Went w the wife's coworkers whose company is way more fun than mine. Got off way too early and saw the seedier sites of tenderloin but got to the bar and enjoyed the drinks. Met Nick the bouncer dude who guessed my age (which is an amazing frat) and kept my word and paid the Beto made to guess my age. But he reciprocated and bought me a beer.  Cool!

They have a tiny outdoor patio where you can smoke n have a good time. Bartenders are way f'g cool n chill. No attitude. Would love to come back and hang w these guys and the crew at this very awesomely named bar!
author: Bob K.

description: Overall fun, down to earth bar. We didn't get to experience the patio, games (pool, shuffleboard, etc.) because by the time we got there it was late and we just wanted a couple more drinks before heading back to our hotel. The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable of where/what we should do while visiting. I'd like to go back and experience it before closing hours.
author: Mayci R.

description:
Emperor Norton's Boozeland is that kind of bar that you think will be a dive but walking in this place is perfect. The whole bar is so meticulously maintained.  Yes, this is in the heat of the 'loin, but hey - only a few blocks from my house so I don't mind walking over to grab a good affordable beer.  The bar is very spacious, seating all around, a couple high tops scattered around, pool tables in the back and even an outdoor patio! Oh also, these are by far some of the cleanest bathrooms at any bar in SF, bravo. 

The bartenders here are always so friendly and attentive. Most draft beers are $5 with a good selection craft IPAs and lagers. I also had the bloody mary on a recent visit and it was fantastic, nice and spicy for a filling booze breakfast. Speaking of breakfast - no food is served here but you can bring your own (I suggest grabbing some food at The Chairman down the street, Bao's and Beers anyone?)

Ah, a great homage to Emperor Norton, cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Good dive bar. $3 tecate and pbr cans, but it also has plenty of other beers on tap. The outdoor seating out back is pleasant and a good escape from the city noise. I enjoyed reading the wikipedia page for Emperor Norton. If it weren't for this bar I probably would have never heard of him.
author: Ben E.

description: A solid local bar / divebar. Check out the upstairs on Friday nights only for a more cozy cabin feel, and you get the magnificent bartender Gia -- Good pours, good company. Cash only, but hey, support your local bar.
author: Mark P.

description: This place is great!! Fun, sweet staff, and good location. The bartender made the yummiest shots and drinks... the bathrooms were actually CLEAN! Like... not gross bar bathrooms with broken doors and mold, for once. I'm so pleased by this spot and can't wait to go back!!!
author: Natalia C.

description: I ended up at this bar for a reunion of sorts with some girlfriends.  I brought my husband along. He made his way to the bar and we visited with one another in the adjoining room. Very cool vibe.  Has huge screens for watching the game. Great friendly staff.  Note that this bar is in an area where you may not want to park your car but it's San Francisco so use your own judgement on that.
author: Jacquelynn K.

description:
Don't come here unless you're 100% healthy, no chronic illnesses, etc. 

The owner of this place is insane. I came in here in the afternoon, and asked to use the bathroom. I do this all the time with bars while I'm out, and it's never a problem. 

The bartender (older blonde) was immediately weird with me, saying if I took more than 3 minutes and I hadn't bought something they'd send the police to knock down the door.... what? I thought she just had a deadpan way of joking that I shouldn't take too long if I wasn't a customer, so I bought a drink. 

Apparently the people who run this place have a problem with people with disabilities and chronic illnesses. If you take "too long" the owner will send the bartender into the bathroom pounding on the door yelling the police are coming if you don't leave NOW. she honestly gave me a panic attack and I didn't get to finish what I came in, paid for, and tipped her (more than double the price I paid for a drink). 

I have anxiety and while I'm trying to figure out wtf is going on, she informs me that I must be doing drugs since I took too long.... ummm, sorry, some of us have medical issues. 

Honestly, the owner of this place must be a cruel person. I'm sorry you bought a bar in the TL... don't take it out on people who have chronic illnesses, it's not my problem. 

I want to add it was HUMILIATING having not only apparently my time trying to use the bathroom TIMED (after buying a drink) but having an employee come in and start violently banging on the door (scary when your pants are down and you're trying to ), but when I was visibly upset and shaking after literally being scared sh**less, the bartender proceeded to not only berate me and encourage and let a male customer to harass me. 

I asked to speak to the owner, and apparently I couldn't. I felt too embarrassed to explain to the bartender in front of the customer why I take longer in the bathroom, I have a lot of anxiety and panic over talking about my illness anyways (it's mortifying as is), and it's something I already have a complex about.

I only wanted to speak to him because I was afraid if I didn't find a bathroom something even more embarrassing would happen.... I needed a bathroom NOW, and so combining that very valid fear, with my anxiety about having to discuss my illness, and my anxiety surrounding people paying attention to how long I take in general actually coming true, AND being frightened while I was in the stall caused me to start crying. Which... of course the bartender and customer decided to insult me for even more. 

I ended up having to take a heavy dose of my anxiety attack medication.... ironic since this happened because the owner was so convinced if I took anything more than 3 minutes I must be doing drugs. 

I can't cant how mortifying it and awful it was. 

What kind of freaking pervert times how long women take to pee so they know how long it "should" take anyways?
author: Tana O.

description:
Great vibe from the people who work there
Outdoor area is a great touch
Pool and shuffleboard games
Good for Groups
Jukebox to play your tunes for a small fee 
Prices are fair
Cash Only

Overall Thoughts

A solid bar option to kickoff good times with friends
author: Eddie W.

description:
EXCELLENT BAR!!

The staff is super friendly. The ambience is very welcoming and they have a patio!! Also games like pool and shuffleboard. Two thumbs up!
author: Jose B.

description:
Like many other reviewers have accurately noted, you think you're heading into a dive bar walking in, but leave pleasantly surprised at how the place manages to combine the unadulterated unpretentiousness of a dive with remarkably sparkling premises - and quite large ones at that.

First and foremost, the servers are friendly and the prices inexpensive. Next, the ambience and clientele are laid-back and welcoming, and what's more, there's so much room to spread out. Literally - as there are many different rooms, spaces, and nooks here. Perfect for many purposes, whether a casual date or for larger, more social groups hanging out over a game of pool. A great find in a neighborhood where you might not expect it.
author: Vincent L.

description:
A story that describes why the five stars-----

Arrived in SF around noon and my check-in time wasnt until 3. I was in the tenderloin walking up Larkin when i see this awesome little bar. I go in. Simple bar! Nothing too fancy but a great selection. Bulleit on the rocks for me. Cash only?! No worries- i have the fondest memories of cash only bars. Head to the ATM, grab some cash and sit for a drink. The bartender was awesome! Kept the conversation going even though it was a quiet morning and i was running on no sleep. I kept ordering drink after drink. There may have been shots involved. Honestly, i dont remember. I had just kicked off my 3-day party weekend after a very long and hard week at work. Theyve got an awesome pool table in there somewhere. The bar looks dark and quiet, but it is by far one of the most welcoming bars i've been into in years. I started smoking cigarettes (hadnt had one in three years) in their beautiful patio and the cigarette hit me like a ton of bricks. I suddenly needed to crash. C'mon- we've all put ourselves in these situations. I knew i had to get out of there. 

I woke up at 11 pm in my hotel room alone with nothing but my wallet. I left my bags, phone, and earphones at the bar. I went back and they were once again very welcoming and had all my stuff!!! The staff were all aware of where all my stuff was and i got it all back. I embarrassingly explained what happened and rather than ridicule me as they should have- they laughed with me and said it happens. I went back to me room and crashed for the night. I fucking love this place!!!!!!
author: Elizabeth A.

description: One of my favorite dive bars in the city.  Straight to the point, no BS bartenders, affordable no BS drinks, great space outdoors, lots of little nooks to hang out in.
author: Alicia T.

description:
#32

Recently, I visited Emperor Norton's Boozeland for a UYE with a few friends.  UYE's are always fun and I was up to try a new bar in the city.  

UYE + Emperor Norton's Boozeland = good times

I found parking fairly easy about one block away and walked up the block to the bar.  I passed the "Sup Bro 50" sign at the Civic Center and I knew I wanted to revisit that spot after a few drinks.  But for now, back to Boozeland.

I walked up to the door and a couple guys were sitting outside, one was a bouncer for sure, and I am not sure who the other guy was, but both were friendly.  I showed my ID and went inside.  

The place is small, dark, loud--a typical bar.  I found the group in the corner and grabbed a seat.  There were tiny little round high top tables littered throughout the bar with stools and candles.  There is a small set of steps up to an area that houses a pool table and the bathrooms.  There are several TVs around the bar as well to watch the game.  It seemed as if there were three separate areas: 1) the dark and tiny place as you walk in; 2) the billiards area; 3) a larger area on the other side of the bar with bigger tables, more chairs and better lighting (at least it was somewhat better lighting).  The bar is in the middle of the room and facilitates drinks to every side of the tiny space.

Boozeland is a cash only bar; however, none to worry, there is an ATM right there in the corner by the door for all of us people who never carry cash.  I cannot even remember the last time I had cash in my purse on purpose.  It is so cumbersome.

I ordered a martini with a twist, it came out dirty, but that is okay.  I knew I would have another; therefore, the bartender would make my drink right on the next go-round.  I never send back drinks--that is a simple form of alcohol abuse in my book.  The drinks were delicious, strong and priced typical of the area.  

There is a jukebox replete with wonderful music.  We had fun talking, listening to tunes and greeting other friends as they showed up to the UYE at Boozeland.  At one point, someone suggested that we go to the Sup Bro sign and take pics.  YES--I knew that was how I wanted to end my night.

I met a couple new friends, saw some old friends and had several laughs with everyone.  I really like Emperor Norton's and will be back in the future.

Stephani Smiles for Emperor Norton's Boozeland ;)
#bringcash
author: Stephani M.

description: "Such a nasty woman!" -- some drunk guy, to the bartender. Good atmosphere and not a bad selection of beer.
author: Jacob M.

description:
Dive bar vibes, friendly staff. Cash only, make it rain.  Shots on shots on shots, just a beer.  Outdoor patio, birthday shout out! Pool shark, #Winning. Push ups, Losers with a capital L.  Great company, fun times.  

There's always drama when we go out but this time, I actually stayed the whole night.  No personality clashes, no drama; just a mellow chill night with lots of laughter = the best kind of nights.  We were somewhat skeptical walking in but the outdoor patio and pool table was a great addition for our wild not so wild group.
author: Linda N.

description:
Fun little bar in the TL that's worth a stop in!

It's cash only which is always slightly annoying, but the drinks are reasonably priced, the music is on point and you can play shuffleboard for a dollar. What's not to love? They've also got a great outdoor patio area that you can bring a dog to (I think I even saw a sign for a doggy friendly happy hour!) 

The bar is nicely split up with the games in the back and just a bar in front, so if you want to sit and chat without getting bumped by a pool cue you can do so easily!
author: Elliott W.

description: RAD bar. Walked in with time to kill at the passport agency. Old school Art Deco vibe, black and gold furnishings + neighborhood dive bar. Bar tender was a delightful gent, and makes a FRIKKIN DELICIOUS michelada. From scratch.
author: Sara B.

description:
And the winner for "Best Named Bar in San Francisco" goes to:  ...Emperor Norton's Boozeland.

Every time I tell people I was here, they seem intrigued by the name.  Granted, about three out of four times I have to clarify that this is the old location of Deco, which occupied the spot a few years back.

And, truly, Emperor Norton, you built a solid empire of booze for fun-loving Civic Loiners to enjoy their libations.  There are four distinctly different areas to the bar, and there's a little something for everyone.  Want to go smoke on the back-patio?  Check.  Want to play some pool or shuffleboard?  Great game room/area.  Have a big group from work (hi, after-work lawyers)?  Big common area with TV's.  Just want to sit at the bar?  Heck, you can do that too.

Good beer selection, and reasonable HH specials until 7pm.  They open fairly early during the week (noon), so you can get a head-start if you wish.  I think it's a really good mix of clientele.  The space is really well decorated - they've done a great job.
author: Adam S.

description:
Spacious bar that has a pool table and a shuffle board in the back room!  That was already a win in my handbook for bars!

Their restrooms are contemporary and clean, which was unexpected for the location that it is in!

5 bucks for a round of beer.  The norm, more or less.

Loud music and they have side tables.  

You had me at the shuffle!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Dog friendly!!! They have a water bowl and treats for your furry friend. Mine sat on top of a table (he's small) and they didn't mind. The bar tender even taught him how to shake!
author: Katie B.

description:
Do you ever feel like you're in a need of a cold beer in the middle of the day... well, they open at noon daily.  

I adore this spot.  It's kitty corner to the Phillip Burton Federal court house and they have great drink/beer happy hour prices.  Looks can be deceiving, from the outside it looks like a smelly dirty dive bar.  However, on the inside it's clean, the staff's very friendly and for all you dog lovers, they let you bring your pup inside.  

There's four sections of the bar.  There's the main bar area as you walk-in.  Then there's a seating area immediately behind the bar with several high tables that can be combined for groups.  There's an area near the back with a pool and shuffle board table.  And finally, there's an outside seating area with several park benches for smoking or just chillin.  

They only accept cash so stop by your credit union before arriving or, use their ATM machine for a $3 fee.
author: Juan V.

description: OK. As Tenderloin dive bars go, it's pretty good. Very small. Friendly bartender. Cocktails pretty good. Old school jukebox with very limited albums, but cheap.  Volume loud--which was good. Pool table $ shuffleboard.
author: So T.

description: I like you Boozeland. You serve a stiff drink, take no shit from whiners, and have bar games. It's a good local bar to meet after work for happy hour and then move on.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Cute little bar around the corner from Chambers.  Stopped in with a group of friends to shoot pool and have drinks after my birthday dinner.  The bouncer and bartender were amazingly rude. The bouncer yelled at us twice while we were playing/shooting pool, saying "We're a small bar and you guys are annoying the people sitting at the bar. You're too loud."  
I will never go back here nor ever recommend anyone else go here.  For a small bar I'd think they'd be appreciative that we came to spend money... I was WRONG. Screw this place and all the people in it.
author: D Marie M.

description: I have lived here in the area since the heyday. I am a musician whom I wont mention. This bar is the least fun in the area. It is nothing but posers and nerdy wannabes. give it a go if thats what you are.
author: Hardy S.

description:
This place is Trouble, friends. Capital T Trouble. I've only been a couple times, usually for a somewhat stumbly nightcap. And it's SO EASY to get in trouble in this place. Whether cocktails or beer are your weakness. 
Yes.
author: Melissa L.

description: Love this genuinely cool bar.  Great bartenders.  Doorman is hot.  I mean a hoot.  Cool atmosphere.
author: Kathy K.

description:
Despite the name this is not a land of booze owned by a dead guy.

This is, however, a cute little bar. 

Some neat chill spots tucked away in corners.
And a particular mirror that I like checking myself out in when I'm beer-sipping.
author: Loli L.

description: This bar has cheap drinks, poor service, and not much going on. I've come here a few times now and each has been miserable. I'm not sure what crowd they are trying to appeal to but it's always nearly empty, playing terrible music, and selling cheap, terrible drinks
author: Blaugh S.

description: Walking through the city before a show, I found this amazing little place. The most friendly bartender and yummy Bloody Mary. Was happy to sit in the window table and people watch for a bit in the morning.
author: Tori P.

description:
Who couldn't love a place with a name like Boozeland! This cash-only, art deco gem, in the middle of the Tenderloin, is an excellent place to grab a brew, shoot some pool or play a game of shuffle board. 

At $5 the beers are pleasingly affordable and better yet, this place is dog friendly. 

Grab your buddies, 4-legged or otherwise, and head over to Emperor Norton's Boozeland!
author: Emily E.

description: One of our usual after work drinking holes with a good happy hour ($1 off drafts). It's got a nice patio outside with a few picnic tables and a mural portrait of Emperor Norton himself. The back of the upstairs has a shuffle board and lots of standing room. The front and the sides are tables. Bartender here is great. Cash only. Good mix of high end, low end beers. Well drinks will get you a buzz. Overall a great place to kick back.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Came here after SF Pride march...couldn't have been more grateful for a friendly staff, yummy drinks, lots of places to sit and a clean bathroom!
author: vanessa a.

description:
My friend was in town, visiting from the far away town called Alameda, with her new squeeze. I wanted to think of a place to go on a Friday night that wasn't going to be obnoxiously packed, and that would not be offering $14 cocktails that took 15 minutes to make. I also wanted a place with a little side action going on, in case the conversation dwindled with this new sidekick of hers. So I chose Emperor Norton's, because the drinks are priced in a decent manner, the atmosphere is lively without being suffocating, and there is pool, shuffle board and video games to keep things interesting.

She liked the place like I thought she would, her date turned out to be a nice guy who also liked the place, and my guy and I stuck around for another cocktail even after they made their journey back to Alameda because Promethius was on a TV screen and we wanted to see the female character have her alien abortion. Rad.
author: Liz M.

description:
Drinks are good.
Cash only. Prices are reasonable.
Attitude is not so much.
Decent space with pool table, shuffleboard, and a small old-school video game console.  Bar seating and tables available.
author: Fannie S.

description:
A lot of creepy bars in the TL.  This is not one of them! Monday afternoon, World Cup playing.  Decided to sneak out of work and have a beer and watch the game.  

Franziskaner on tap. Check! Estaminet on tap check! 2 Tv's.  Just dark enough to forget about the real world, but not too dark that you cant decipher if some one is hot or not.  Guy behind the bar was helpful and down to earth.  Pool Table, Outdoor Patio.  Not too hip.  A great spot if you are in the TL.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Cash only, clean and well stocked "dive bar" always a good time with friends here. One of the better places near Polk for me. Good beer selection on tap, most drinks 4 or 5 bucks. Like the upstairs bar.
author: Doug R.

description: All was good until Liam turned up on the 5th day! Aussies that own things abroad, automatically think they're gods! From one Aussie to another... Liam, you're a fuckwit mate!
author: Ad R.

description:
Very cool bar but WATCH OUT for their ATM. They are cash only so I tried to use it to buy drinks for my myself and my friends. It didn't give me the $60 I requested but still took the money from my bank account - not okay! Luckily the bartender/owner is helping me deal with this ridiculous, sneaky ATM.

The bar has Photohunt, a pool table, shuffle board, and reasonably priced drinks. I'll come back but will get my cash elsewhere (and I'll save ATM receipts in the future if money does not come out!).
author: Meghan P.

description:
I'll start off by saying that my friend's boyfriend owns the place, so my opinion is likely more biased than most. 

When she told me that it was opening, I sent a message out to all my friends at Hastings hoping that they would check it out because I'm SO sick of Soluna (the go- to place for drinks for Hastings students). 

 And they did check it out!  And they liked it. And they brought more Hastings students.  And we all lived happily ever after.

But srsly, check it out.  It's chill!  I get that it's in the tenderest loin, but just go earlier if that really freaks you out.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Spent several afternoons and evenings here. The bar is broken up into a few areas, providing many seating areas and a good amount of tables - nice to have options! I've enjoyed many games of Photo Hunt over drinks here. Service can be slow to the point that it might be worth ordering two rounds at a time. We did see/kill a cockroach there recently, for which we received two of our drinks for free!
author: Rose J.

description: This place could be fun, but the negatively steaming from the door staff sours the environment. Fortunately there are other options nearby.
author: Mark F.

description:
Folks: let's not lose our minds. This ain't no "boozeland" in the sense that the chairs are assembled from slats of solidified vodka or that the proprietor is a talking bottle of absinthe. It's a bar, in the TL, and they sling affordable beverages. 

And it's a lot bigger than it looks; there is a pool table and other table games in the back. There's plenty of seating/standing around their massive U-shaped bar and you can get served on either side. This is a solid spot to bring a medium-sized group of friends for Tenderloin drinks.

If a warm day ever graces SF -- fat chance -- have a seat on their secret patio out back. I've said too much.

Obligatory Title Pun: The EMPEROR'S new close.

Menu Readability: Is there one?

Need to mention: They have those trivia cocktail napkins. I wish more places had these.

What this place teaches me about myself: I can't keep a secret.
author: Vivek S.

description: Definitely not in the nicest part of town, but exceeds expectations once you get through the door. Nice beer selection, pool, and a jukebox-- also someone figured out the appropriate music volume so you still feel like you can have a conversation.
author: K.K. W.

description: In pain English. It's the shit. Awesome decor. Clean.  Could spend hours here.  Courtney was our bartender and she's a hell of a good time. Good music, good vibes! - T from Jerzeeeeee
author: Tamara C.

description: I would give zero stars based on the bouncer with the beard alone.  He refused to take my ID (which is real, by the way) and then stated that I was lucky that he wouldn't take my ID but he was refusing me entry.  His reason as to why he wouldn't take it when I asked him?  "Because I don't like it."  Let me add that I'm also a woman of color.   Discrimination much, bouncer?  My friends and I will stay far away from this establishment as possible.
author: Rose A.

description: Awesome beer!!! German pils. $5 kolsch  cool place!!! Bartender tried to sweat me about pic...not too cool
author: Rich M.

description: The door man was the rudest least empathetic person I've ever encountered in my life! It was our friend's birthday party tonight and my boyfriend was having the worst day ever and tried to sit out front for a min to have a cigarette before we went in and the guy told him he couldn't, not even sit on the curb which is a public place and long story short the guy ended up not allowing my boyfriend in because of it even after my boy tried to apologize and "fix it" and I even tried to politely explain the situation and why he was upset in the first place. We ended up missing a very special event and took our business and money elsewhere at a nearby bar all because this doorman had an ego. This place looks awesome and I might have been a new regular since my friends just moved in upstairs but I will never come back because of the way we were treated.
author: Catherine P.

description: Best bar I've been to in sf in a long time. The bartender was a sassy lady she was great. Lol come for the cheap drinks stay for the shit show that ensues. Had a blast!!
author: Brad P.

description:
Picky about customer service lived in San Francisco longer than most techies have been alive but how could that be since I'm only 21.

Love this place!

Visited ENB after a long day of art-slaving and fruit & veg shopping  at Civic Center Famers Market enough SF bohemian name dropping - dude behind the bar had ...gasp, MANNERS!! He actually was clever enough to effectively read people and believe that I've  lived in Little Saigon for, well, a hell of a long time.

Being a mannered man he bought the first drink the second one cost six bucks!

Real about getting chicks in the bar.
Chicks like wine. Chicks don't like 10 dollar basic wine at least not this chick. If I am paying 10 bucks for a basic glass of wine it'd better be served by a half-naked man who does hair and nails.

Shared the table with some ladies who were  plus size.
More realness!  
Anorexic SF gals are usually tweeking  big girls are more relaxed so I wanted to keep drinking cause it was  relaxing the vibe is cool but I stopped at 2 and will visit ENB  this week but don't listen to me I've only lived in San Francisco since 1984.
author: SF T.

description:
Kevin (one of the owners) was very responsive and addressed my concerns the next time I came through.  Kudos to him for taking ownership of customer experience. 

If I could exclude my experience with the bouncer this would be a 5 star experience.  Michelle, Meech, Johnny, and Kevin are rockstars, no doubt.  Eiher the bouncer hasn't been trained to their standards or he just hates life in general. Nonetheless this is the epitome of a great divebar and they truly take care of their regulars. GREAT PEOPLE, GREAT SERVICE, AND GREAT PRICES!

Word of advice for the ownership group...check your bouncers.   Bad first impression!
author: Robert B.

description: Waited at the bar for 15mins until some other patron got the attention of the bar tender (blonde female). The drinks are good. Just hit or miss service!
author: San S.

description: Great neighborhood bar. Friendly people both staff and clientele. Make sure to check out the  garden out back.
author: David B.

description:
I came here for the name, was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked the place. There's a nice "upscale-psuedo-dive-bar" thing going on here that should scratch any dive-related itch you have.

To wit: they've got the requisite dimly lit barside area, the spacious game room (feat. shuffleboard and a (purple) pool table), the dark corner booths, and the outdoor patio (with Pabst BR-themed street art, of course).

Nice beer/liquor selection, friendly bartender. I'd definitely come back.
author: Ryan D.

description: If you want professional service and exceptionally well made drinks come see : Emily at Emperor Norton's BoozeLand ! A real pro behind the bar - no nonsense service and a smile to light up the dark side of the moon.
author: Armando C.

description:
I went to ENB during the day on a Thursday and had a super friendly bartender (blond lady) - 5* for her! Went there on Friday night and had one of THE WORST experiences I ever had with a bartender!!!  After asking the female bartender (dark short hair) if I could charge my phone for a couple minutes because I was waiting for my friends call she gave me an attitude right away that she does NOT do it normally. I thanked her for doing it and she "barked" at me to get out of her bar - I was about an inch behind the bar with my foot!!! 
Now the worst part :
I turned around and was looking for my friend who was with me and another friend told me that he got kicked out by the other female (blond/short hair) bartender!!! I went to her and asked what the problem was and she told me that my friend was too drunk and was stumbling around so she kicked him out ! He had ONE beer !!!!!!!! So I told her that my friend is absolutely sober and is definitely NOT drunk!!!! So she said she will go outside and talk to him. She came back and apologized for kicking him out. 
The attitude those two female bartenders have is absolutely unbelievable !! I work as a bartender myself and would NEVER treat my customers like this period ! I would be very surprised if those two girls would make any tips at all !!!! My guests are tipping me for making great cocktails and being friendly and social. Definitely NOT those two!!!!!
If I would own this bar I would fire both of them in a heart beat! 
Great bar - ridiculous horrible service !!!!!!!!!  (besides the nice blond girl who works thew day shift)
author: Sfo993 B.

description:
Why is no one making a bigger deal about how freaking good the bloody mary is???
It's spicy, sure, but the best part about it is the addition of pickle juice which makes it briny and crisp and delicious. Super basic garnish with a lovely pepper top seals the deal. I got a mary and a wee baby MGD for ten bucks.
And they gave me the can of tomoato juice so I could refill as I went. 
lovely staff and surprisingly classy atmostphere inside. If it wasn't in the deep tenderloin I'd call it a great first date spot.
author: Molly S.

description:
Place sucks!!! Bartenders suck and are rude!!
Prices are determined by the bartenders and the same homeless guy is always at the bar
author: John H.

description:
I used to love Deco and was sooo happy to hear that the place would re-open. Soooo much potential. Marlenas did something similar in Hayes valley and re opened as a  trendy spot Brass Tax. Unfortunately the same did not happen here.

The first time a group of us came back since the reOpen it was awesome. Cheapish drinks, fun pool table and awesome improvements to the outdoor patio. The bartender was way cool too. Dark hair and ?tattoos? I think.. Neway, this even was on a Sunday and was enjoyable enough for us to return the following Saturday. Waayyyyy different experience...

We arrived and noticed a different (completely wasted) bigger blond woman tending bar. We ordered a whiskey ginger and two last words (I was staring at the chartreuse and maraschino and it looked sooo good). She futsed around a bit and came back with the  whiskey ginger then went away. We waited...and waited... Then we made eye contact again and re ordered the drinks. She drunkenly rolled her eyes and told is she didn't know what that was. So we changed our order to two negronis.. Off she went.. 

She took a shot with a ?friend? Took another groups drink orders.. Nearly knocked over a bottle from the bar as she staggered to make someone else's drink. THIS WAS ALL AT 5pm!!! Holy smokes.. I'd bet she had a rough Sunday.. We cut our loses (time) and left. I was sooo hoping this would keep on being a cool place but apparently the staff (minus the awesome woman from the first night) are incompetent...The second star is for our first night and I won't be back unless I poke my head in and see her.. IF I happen to be in the neighborhood
author: Taster B.

description: Bartenders were very attentive and prompt. Cocktails were good. The door guy was unfriendly and downright gave me the creeps, he made me really uncomfortable as we showed out ID. Even after I tried to lighten the mood help him crack a smile he gave an unrelenting stare! We had a couple drinks and left, and even as we left the bar he was inside the bar glaring from a dark corner. The door guy is very very creepy!!
author: Jessica E.

description: The doorman here will literally accost you. Mali - What a jerk. Kicked me out the night of my wedding after one drink. Made sure my pregnant cousin could catch and Uber and wouldn't let me back in. Cash bar. Meh. Overly filled. Meh. Classic tenderloin bar gentrifying in front of your eyes.
author: Jason M.

description:
How come I just found out about this place like now?
I mean, if I were in my twenties, I would give it 5 stars!  Damn, time.  Damn.
A co-worker of mine had his going away party here and I was hesitant to go...you know, drink around fellow employees.  Things always get awkward...but I joined the fun and managed not to make a complete ass of myself!  I can't believe this little gem of a bar was a foot away from me for the past year...crazy.

Here's the pro list:
1.) Great Bartenders
2.) Awesome atmosphere
3.) Back yard/patio with tables
4.) Pool table in another area
5.) They let you have food delivered if you're wasted and need to soak it up!
6.) Good prices

And the cons: 
1.) Neighborhood

Clearly the pros outweigh the cons, so drink up!
author: Alex T.

description:
How could one possibly resist the allure of a kingdom known as Boozeland?  
If that's not the promise of a good time then nothing is!

So, this a new bar that's clearly owned and run by experienced, cool people.  They  know what they're doing and have clearly thought about their space.  The front section is a remodel / vast improvement of the place that was previously there.  Just that part is a great place to chill out and have a drink.  But follow me!  The good times continue in the back with shuffleboard, a sweet-ass purple pool table and a comfortable booth where you can share your most intimate, kinky, dirty, nasty secrets.  Or just a pitcher with friends.  Your choice.

Let's pretend for a moment that you get tired of shooting the shit, shooting pool and sipping delectable double IPAs.  You and I are probably not on speaking terms at this point, but let's pretend...  

You're in the 'Loin. 
Ok.  
Feel like sitting outside? 
Yup.  
Want to enjoy your cold beer, but don't want to be panhandled, accosted by crack zombies or hassled by "the man"?  
Fuckin' a right! 
Where, oh where do you go?  
To the back patio!  
They have really thought of everything.

On a hot date?  Come and sip a cold one here with your hottie.
Just got out of work and need liquid refreshment?  This place has it.  In glassware, son!

Oh, there's cool music on the jukebox too.  You can pick the songs while I beat you at pool.  Oh, thanks for the IPA!  How did you know?  Wait, how'd you just make those four balls?  Have I been drinking...?

What do you mean this review makes me look like an alcoholic?  I'll have you know, good sirs, that I only drink on days ending in y!
author: Jon L.

description: Stopped in for a beer as I was waiting for a friend to arrive in SF. Since I was new to SF, I asked the blonde female bartender for some beer recommendations in the city. She was incredibly helpful and started writing down 5 or 6 top beer bars/breweries along with addresses and background info. She gave me some great tips and was very friendly. I can't ask for much more out of a bartender. Great place/great service. I'll be back in with my friend during this trip.
author: Kyle W.

description:
You've decided to take an improv comedy class in hopes of overcoming your crippling fear of public, semi-public, and non-public speaking. Since you found out about this particular class from a flier posted on the message board of your local laundromat - in-between a flier for a lost overweight Persian cat named "His Meowjesty," and a coupon for "15% Off Sapphire North's 30 Minute Spiritual Psychic Healing Session" - it really doesn't surprise you when your class ends up being in the back of a  white 1984 windowless Ford Econoline van parked at the corner of 6th and Mission. 

"Can anyone tell me the first rule of improv?" your instructor, Christian Lightning, a part time magician and two-time felon, asks to the group, as he takes a slow drag from a glass stem connected to a hollow bulb, filled with a rocky substance. Your classmates, a malnourished Mexican foreign exchange student who misses his pet turtle, a recently married lesbian couple from Texas who own and operate the largest iguana farm in California, and that old-timey villain who ties ladies to railroad tracks, all shake their head side to side in a 'no' fashion. 

"Yes and pass," Christian says, and hands you the glass pipe. "Never forget that." 

Two hours later you will all be arrested for smoking meth in the back of a van. Your improv instructor will have to serve some heavy time since he was on parole.

Because you've read Tina Fey's "Bossy Pants" you are pretty sure you can organize your own improv class. Invite all of your old classmates over to Emperor Norton's Boozeland, which is the raddest new bar in the city and the perfect spot for starting a comedy troupe. A pool table, shuffleboard, patio, whiskey, tables, booths, beer and bears oh my it has everything. "This is the bar Gotham deserves, and also the one it needs," you think to yourself. So we'll drink there. Because this bar can take it. Because it's not our hero. It's a silent guardian, a watchful protector. A dark knight. "You know that day that you once told me about, when Gotham would no longer need Batman? It's coming," you say to your group, as you take a pull from the glass pipe.

"AND SCENE! AND SCENE! AND SCENE!" you hear your classmates yelling at you, which has become code word for "Stop smoking all the meth!" 

It's then that you take a cold hard look at yourself in the mirror that's mounted above one of the greatest booth seating areas of any bar you've been to and realize that you are wearing a Spiderman mask and one big plastic green Hulk glove on your left hand. Some dark knight you are. 

"And scene indeed..." you whisper to yourself, crushing the meth pipe in your Hulk glove and vowing to never do improv again, as you walk out of one of the coolest bars in the city.
author: Dave G.

description: Cool vibe. Outside patio is hidden in the back and probably the coolest in the neighborhood. Bring cash
author: Matthew A.

description:
TOTAL Awesomeness!  Love the vibe and crazy 80s ish feel. Michelle, the bartender, was uber nice.  My phone was out of juice and of course, I needed to "check in" on yelp.  Tah-dah, Michelle came to the rescue and hooked my phone up with some electrical lovin' with an outlet behind the bar.  Heart it so much!  

Killer restroom... with high profile toilets and it reminds me of Japan b/c you can press for a "#1" or "#2" type of flush.  What can I say???   I'm easily entertained.

This is a great place for GROUPS.  I totally encourage drunken debauchery with CROWDS of people here.. they seriously have the space!  I didn't wander downstairs because it was COLD, but saw a stairway leading to what looks like OUTDOOR patio seating ...SCHWEEET!  

I ordered Henny because I was too much of a wuss to try the ORANGE PUNCH.  I'm sure I would have been a TKO if I had gone that direction even if watered down.

Of course, the neighborhood can be a little "iffy" at night, but it's up and coming (like the Jefferson's...) and I totally loved it that when I walked in the door there was a HELLA cute pitbull with a huge head wagging its tail greeting me and trying to kiss me.  AWWWW --- AWWWW...
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Love coming here for happy hour and shuffle board! 

bartenders are nice and beers are cheap! can't ask for more for hh!
author: Kelly H.

description: Great dive bar.  friendly staff and cheap drinks.  It can get crowded at bar at times which makes it difficult to order drinks.
author: Jessica S.

description: My favorite bar in the tenderloin, maybe all of SF. I stayed in town for a month earlier in the year on business and this place just happened to be both on my walk home and fairly close to where I was staying. Cheap drinks, good people, ball breaking but friendly bartenders, a great jukebox and a pool table. Also it's a pretty big place so it's usually never packed. Pretty much anything a man needs from a bar. One thing that should be mentioned for those not familiar with the tenderloin is that the surrounding area is sketchy as hell. The first night I went there I was warned to take an uber instead of catching a cab because supposedly if people saw me catching a cab they'd know I had cash and I might get robbed, but I never had any problems and I walked home almost every night. Plus the bar has security and does a great job of keeping anyone looking to cause trouble out. All in all a great place.
author: Matt R.

description:
Warning: cash only

Awesome! Great atmosphere, fun games, chill crowd, and clean dive bar! 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Elsa S.

description: Pool table, shuffle board, juke box and cash only. Sounds like a good bar, looks like a good bar, must be a good bar right? Large selection of draft or bottled beer to accompany a full scale bar is nice. The place can get busy so coming a few drinks in, or early is a good choice. Did I mention Cash only? They have an atm but it charges you $3 and so do the bartenders when you ask for three different draft beers ... or she couldn't do math. One or the other. Overall a pretty chill place you can get a beer at with your friends or a date if you don't mind sitting on top of each other to hear what's going on.
author: Steve L.

description: This place borders on a dive.  The street that its sits on is definitely divey.  The drinks here are descent.  The crowd gets loud on Friday's and Saturday's.  DO NOT PARK YOUR CAR ON THE SURROUNDING STREETS.  My car got the rear small triangular shaped window broken into and riffled through.  It looses a star for location, but if you survive the lay-of-the-land surrounding, you will be fine once you get inside.
author: Jane O.

description: We came during the St. Paddy's parade, and seemingly all the firedogs were here. But everyone was just hanging out and having a good time, so it was cool. This place is MUCH bigger than Harrington's down the road, with the same sort of booze selection. It's definitely more my style of bar, so I'm being biased with my score.
author: John H.

description:
After the fun/sh*tshow of opening night (which, full-disclosure, left one friend unable to remember how he got home, and me puking in the street - good times!) we decided to give it another go. There were nine of us, and we all fit into the cozy seating area upstairs. The outdoor area is cool to hang out in, too.

Surprisingly spacious, clean and dog-friendly. All good things.

Gotta say I really like this place. As long-time Bender's-ites, we knew the staff was cool, but they really seem in their element here (but what's with the happy, smiling, Kevin? Disconcerting!)

One star off because, seriously, WTF is up with the women's bathroom? The toilets are so high! Needing to be on my tiptoes to get to the seat is not cool!
author: Ms J.

description: Great new bar! The bartenders are great and the drinks are good and well priced. They have a pool table, shuffle board and patio out back. It's a perfect place to chill at the bar or have big groups, the place is huge!! My new regular bar!
author: Courtney P.

description:
Nice new bar, clean and pleasant but not fancy. They have some of my favorites (Franziskaner on tap, Herradura silver, Templeton rye and Lagavulin). 

There's wooden tables with bar chairs throughout, and a large booth, pool table and shuffleboard (yessss!) in the back room.
author: Teo W.

description: Tenderloin.   Tech douchebags should avoid this place at all costs.  It represents the best of the tenderloin prior to the influx of people finding this neighborhood 'edgy'. The bartenders are amazing.  Michi rocked my world. So professional,  beautiful and knowledgeable about drinks. Perfect SF experience.
author: Joseph R.

description:
Excellent new bar with back patio, pool table and well priced drinks. Checked it out last Friday with a bunch of friends. 

Definitely a fun spot with a hip (but not too hip) crowd. Neighborhood is better than I remember it to be. I'll definitely go back soon.
author: Hank S.

description: Great spot for a relaxing Sunday afternoon game of cards paired with a few g&t's. One star is just for the back patio - it's wonderful to be able to have a drink in the fresh air - sitting inside a bar on a sunny day is way too depressing. There was a bit too much smoke in the air for me but to each their own...
author: Erin W.

description: The owner Kevin messaged me about my recent unpleasant experience hear and apologized for the strange night... I really appreciated that he took the time to read my review. While I would be open to trying Norton's again in the future, I'm not sure if I can convince my friends to again...but I shall try!
author: Rachel C.

description: The service at this place is the worst, unless Courtney or one of the other female bartenders gets to you. Everytime I come in, the guys behind the bar are just ignoring people...EVERYTIME! Not only that but they have no fucking clue on how to act in public. The tall bald guy had a massive meltdown over some shit one day I was in there, punching the bar and just acting like an idiot. I went in last night just to see what the male/female ratio was (fucking sausage fest) and 3 bartenders were behind the bar but only 1 was working. The tall bald guy and the fat guy with with long 80s metal hair were standing around looking stupid, talking to some girl at the end of the bar while paying customers stood around trying to get drinks. Another fine example on how service sucks in SF.
author: Michael G.

description: Cheap drinks, big bar. Nice for a Thursday.
author: Anjolie C.

description: Loved it! We came here for happy hour the other day, on a Friday, and it was lively without being crowded. The bar offers good drink specials (hard to find in SF), I had my pick of the IPA's for $3 and pitchers were $12, mixed with a ton of space, outdoor patio, and overall very chill vibe. Can't wait to come back!
author: Louis D.

description: The drinks were cheap and we had a fun time playing shuffleboard, especially after the table glitched out and quit scoring the game so we could play as long as we wanted.  I can't really recommend this as a place to go out of your way to visit though.  Something about it creeped me out a little bit, probably the black wallpaper and suspiciously large stalls in the ladies' room.  Also, if you're not a smoker don't bother going out onto the back patio.  That's pretty much what it's for, I couldn't stay out there for long.  I'd go there for happy hour beers again.  I was pleasantly surprised at the "not bud" brews on tap for the price they were offering.
author: Diana W.

description: So I was in town for a friends wedding and Beyond Wonderland (electronic music festival) and decided that me and my girlfriend would just wing it and not do the Normal tourist thing so we came here as we ended up here. The bartender Michelle was the best she not only gave us tips and advice on what to do but she gave us a crash course on the SF culture. I recommend this place to anybody looking for a chill bar during happy hours which is when I went. The place itself is very clean very nice and awesome vibe with cool local characters walking in and out. 5 stars thanks Michelle you are amazing and we loved Golden Gate park if I'm ever back in town I'll make it a point to stop by have some drinks and chat it up.
author: Robert R.

description: I love this place! It's so nice to have a cool place to go to in the tenderloin before and after shows or whenever I'm in the hood. It's so awesome that they have an out door area and truly the best bar staff ever. I always feel at home! And particularly the blond girl with the big smile. What a sweetheart! She is the sweetest most inviting girl!
author: Curly G.

description: Quite the change from the Deco days, very nice redo. Some cool drink specials
author: Lauren V.

description: Shuffle board, a patio (which closes at 9 or 10), and dog friendly! Yes please!
author: Julie B.

description: close to bart, sweet happy hour deals, fast nice bartenders and a back patio. oh & clean bathrooms.. 5 stars.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Very, very clean! Really cute wallpaper and efficient bar service. The outside patio is also nicely kept and there was always good music playing. Pool table, shuffle board (a fancy one) and pac man to play. Will def be back!
author: Ashley M.

description: Credit where credit is due - this is a perfect spot for a low-key drinking night with friends. We commandeered some corner tables for cards night cause goodness knows my apartment is too small to host more than 2 guests. Noise level is fine, bathrooms are squeaky clean, drinks are good and cheap, staff is friendly and attentive. They even let us order pizza delivery when we realized we were all drunk and hangry. This is definitely going to be a new regular spot.
author: Brynn D.

description: Just divey enough (but actually pretty nice), new bar in the Tenderloin (don't be a big baby about The Loin). They have an Irish bartender named Liam, Woodford Reserve Bourbon, and allow doggies - pretty perfect.
author: Holly R.

description: Good pub and service is ok too. Really like the beer patio outside and there is a fireplace which is good for cold days.
author: Alice T.

description: Great, big windows to enjoy the local entertainment that is Larkin St! Hallelujah for great drinks at great prices in a sultry & fun filled setting. Thanks to the bartenders - who are all fabulous.
author: Colleen B.

description: Great owners. Great bartenders. Great clientele. Everyone is super friendly and the booze flows freely and is cheap. What else could one possibly want?
author: Da Wei S.

description: Pretty nice spot in the tenderloin. About 10 beers on tap. Cash Only. Pool table and shuffle board.
author: Kajal G.

description:
This place is awesome.
Cool bar setup, outdoor hangout/smoking area.
And they have Science trivia napkins!
And, you say there's a rumor it used to be a sex club??  This place is awesome!
Come support your new neighborhood bar.
author: rob h.

description: A drinking oasis in the Loin.  The front door has images of ballerinas dancing and a creepy mannequin that supposed to be Emperor Norton.  I wonder what this building used to be.  Anyway the bar is great, good bartenders, juke box, pool table in the back and downstairs is an outside area for smokers featuring a giant bunny head.  What else can you ask for?
author: Molly B.

description: Bunch of cool blokes behind the bar,  short but good list of beers on tap. Back patio and a much bigger space than you'd imagine for a "dive" bar. And the toilettes give a #1 or #2 flush option! How moderne!
author: Nora M.

description: Love it, another great spot to hang and drink with friends from the guys who run another favorite, Benders in the Mission.
author: Gordon A.

description: Emperor Norton's is my favorite destination for an afternoon of playing shuffleboard and enjoying some good beer.  The bartenders are friendly and have always provided great service.   They've got a nice selection of tunes on the jukebox and an outdoor patio with picnic tables and a cool mural of the Emperor himself.    The art deco bar is really something to behold.  This is now my go to spot in the TL and I look forward to many more fun times in Boozeland.
author: Michelle L.

description:
visited from santa cruz. would never go back to emperor. loud, obnoxious, rude , kids who do not know how to communicate with anything but a computer.

absolutely disgusting .  smoke weed. forget the booze and boozeland. do yourself a favor.
author: Db C.
